snippet: In the wake of the deadly shooting in Connecticut, some legislators have remained silent, but liberal Democrats said it was time to move forward with serious gun laws.
abstract: Pres Obama, during emotional address on the mass shooting in Newtown, Conn, pledges to take 'meaningful action' to prevent similar tragedies from occurring in the future; cautious statement is immediately criticized for being too timid, but also signals that the country's long-dormant debate over gun laws will likely be re-engaged.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERICA GOODE
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Erica Goode from New York.

lead_paragraph: In the wake of the deadly shooting in Connecticut, some legislators have remained silent, but liberal Democrats said it was time to move forward with serious gun laws.

headline.seo: Obama’s Reaction to Connecticut Shooting Sets Stage for Gun Debate
headline.main: Obama’s Cautious Call for Action Sets Stage to Revive Gun Debate
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Cautious Call for Action Sets Stage to Revive Gun Debate
